rationale: No field in the target schema corresponds to the schema version information.
No matching description field found in the target schema.
'tissue_id' in the source schema directly correlates to the 'parent_sample_id' in the target schema, both representing the unique identifier of the sample.
No equivalent field for capturing the execution date and time of the assay in the target schema.
Both fields represent the DOI of a protocol from protocols.io. The description and usage align closely, indicating an exact match.
No direct match for the operator responsible for executing the assay in the target schema.
No corresponding field for the email of the operator in the target schema.
No matching field for the principal investigator in the target schema.
No matching field for the email of the principal investigator in the target schema.
The source field 'assay_type' is directly comparable to the 'dataset_type' in the target schema, representing the specific assay executed.
Both fields represent the analyte class, such as DNA, measured in the assay.
Both fields are intended to specify whether a specific molecule is targeted for detection.
Both fields describe the vendor of the acquisition instrument used in the assay.
Both fields refer to the model of the acquisition instrument.
These fields both describe the number of nuclei or cells input into the assay.
The source field describes a specific protocols.io link for cell isolation, while the target field is more general but can include the same information.
Both fields specify whether the assay involves a technical replicate.
Both fields describe the adapter sequences used in the library preparation.
Both fields describe the average fragment size of the sequencing library.
Both fields represent the concentration value of the library submitted for sequencing.
Both fields describe the unit of measurement for the library concentration value.
No equivalent field for library creation date in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the final yield of the library after the last PCR amplification step.
Both fields represent the unit of measurement for the final library yield.
No corresponding field found for a unique library ID in the target schema.
Both fields specify whether the library was generated for single-end or paired-end sequencing.
'library_pcr_cycles' refers to the number of PCR cycles in the source schema, while 'number_of_pcr_cycles_for_indexing' refers to PCR cycles for indexing specifically.
Both fields describe the reagent kit used for library preparation.
No direct equivalent for sample quality metrics in the target schema.
No equivalent field for PhiX percentage in the target schema.
Both fields specify the number of sequencing cycles in each round of sequencing.
No matching field found for Q30 percentage in the target schema.
Both fields specify the reagent kit used for sequencing.
No matching field found for transposition kit number in the target schema.
Both fields describe the method or kit used for transposition.
No equivalent field for transposase source in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the path of the file with ORCID IDs for dataset contributors.
Both fields describe the path to the file or directory containing raw or processed data.
